heisig_chinese_memo: FOUR year-olds often put their FOOT (human legs) in their MOUTH but they are too young to realize it.
heisig_story: This character is composed of two primitive elements, mouth and human legs, both of which we will meet in the coming lessons. Assuming that you already knew how to write this kanji, we will pass over the "story" connected with it until later. Note how the second stroke is written left-to-right and then top-to-bottom. This is consistent with what we have already seen in the first three numbers and leads us to a general principle that will be helpful when we come to more complicated kanji later on: write north-to-south, west-to-east, northwest-to-southeast.

koohiiStory2: I imagine a giant devouring a human in four bites. First the giant bites off the personÂ´s head, then he bites the torso, then from the waist to the knees, and finally the giant plucks up the remaining portion of the human legs into his mouth. See the fourth bite falling in there?

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Imagine contorting yourself in such a way that your legs end up inside your mouth. You have bent your body in all the wrong ways in order to achieve this. In fact, if you look at yourself, you look like a square now... You're just a person with four sides.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you can get to square, you should be able to get to four as well, since squares always have four sides.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This amazing feat, which turned you into a four sided square, has you looking like a four sided animal: the sheep (ã—). Look at yourself in the mirror and see an adorable four-sided sheep looking back at you. (You can't see the other sides because mirrors aren't 3D and whatnot. So you're a bit cartoonish.)
WaniKani_Reading_Info: What's better than one four sided sheep?

origin_of_ch_char_book: Before the invention of Hanzi (Chinese characters), the Chinese used knots (rope) or simple symbols. As the society became more complex, the need for more efficient ways for communication were needed. Hanzi (Chinese characters) were developed to meet such needs. What did the early writers think to express number â€œoneâ€? As children use their fingers to count, the ancient people used twigs and sticks to express numbers and to count. A twig (ä¸€, yi, one), two twigs (äºŒ, er, two), three twings (ä¸‰, san, three) four twigs (å››, si=ssu, four) became the letters from 1 to 4. Branches used for telling fortunes or for calculation (14th-19th century) However, â€œoneâ€ ä¸€ (yi, one) does not simply mean the number one in the numerical sense. In AD 100, a Chinese scholar wrote a book â€œShuo Wen Jie Ziâ€ which provides many explanations behind Hanzi. Among over 9,000 Hanzi characters in this book, the â€œone (ä¸€)â€ is explained first as followed: â€œIn the beginning there was only One Way, and this Way divided earth from heaven and made everything.â€ As we can see, â€œoneâ€ is not just a simple tree twig. It is also philosophically understood as the â€œsole principleâ€ from which heaven, earth and living things originate d from.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle draws from the four horizontal planes, like the horizontal position (Xu Zhongshu), the accumulation of four sections is the number, the original meaning is four.

The inscriptions on the oracle bones were inherited in the early inscriptions, and after the Spring and Autumn Period, there was a form of writing " four ", which was similar to the ancient inscriptions of Shuo Wen. Scholars believe that the " four " form is the original word for "å‘¬", which resembles the breath exhaled from the mouth and nose. "Dialect": "Hey, breathe out." "Shuowen": "Dongyi says that breathe out is mournful" (Ding Shan, Zeng Xiantong). Because the sound is the same, " four " is used as the number four, so the word "å‘¬" is added beside the mouth to express the original meaning of four.

Jia Jinwen is used as a numeral to indicate four. Wu Kesi: "Wang Yi (given) without horses (four) horses".

"Said Wen": "Four, Yin number also. Like the shape of a quarter. All four belongings are from four. ğ¦‰­, ancient text four. I, Yiwen four."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle draws from the four horizontal lines, like the horizontal position of the bar (Xu Zhongshu), the accumulation of four points is a number, the original meaning is four.

Basic explanation of words
four
sÃ¬
Several names, three plus one (usually capitalized "4" on banknotes and receipts): Quartet. four sides. Four Sequences (ie "Four Seasons"). Four-body (a. refers to human limbs; b. refers to four fonts: Kai, Cao, Li, and seal). Siku (a representative name for the four parts of ancient books, Scripture, History, Zi, and Ji. Also known as "four parts"). The Four Gentlemen (the general term for the four flower subjects of plum, orchid, bamboo and chrysanthemum in Chinese painting).
The notation of Chinese ancient music score is equivalent to "6" in numbered musical notation.

Radicals: å£, å„¿  (mouth, legs)
Meaning Mnemonic
Imagine contorting yourself in such a way that your legs end up inside your mouth. You have bent your body in all the wrong ways in order to achieve this. In fact, if you look at yourself, you look like a square now... You're just a person with four sides.
If you can get to square, you should be able to get to four as well, since squares always have four sides.
Reading Mnemonic
This amazing feat, which turned you into a four sided square, has you looking like a four sided animal: the sheep (ã—). Look at yourself in the mirror and see an adorable four-sided sheep looking back at you. (You can't see the other sides because mirrors aren't 3D and whatnot. So you're a bit cartoonish.)
What's better than one four sided sheep?
